title: 4 Ways to View Websites in Desktop Mode on iPhone

steps.title: Navigate to the website in the Safari app.
steps.content: Navigate to the website in the Safari app. Open the Safari browser app on your iPhone and type the URL of the website you want to visit into the address bar. Then, tap go to load the site. [1] X Research source Depending on the preferences you’ve set for the app, the address bar may be located at either the top or bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the aA button.
steps.content: Tap the aA button. Look for this button to the left of the address bar. Tap it to open a popup menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Request Desktop Website.
steps.content: Select Request Desktop Website . About halfway down the popup menu, you’ll see the option to Request Desktop Website . Tap this button to switch from the mobile version of the site you’re viewing to the desktop version. [3] X Research source This setting only applies to the current tab and won’t affect any other websites that are currently open in Safari.

steps.title: Open the website in the Safari app.
steps.content: Open the website in the Safari app. If there’s a website you visit frequently that you prefer to use in desktop mode, you can permanently change the settings for that website in Safari. To start, enter the URL of the website you want to visit in the address bar of the Safari app, then tap go .

steps.title: Tap aA at the top of the window.
steps.content: Tap aA at the top of the window. This button is located to the left of the address bar. Depending on your Safari settings, you might find the address bar at the bottom of the screen instead of the top. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select Website Settings from the menu.
steps.content: Select Website Settings from the menu. When the menu pops up, tap Website Settings , which should appear just below Request Desktop Website . This will open a new menu screen. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle on Request Desktop Website.
steps.content: Toggle on Request Desktop Website . At the top of the Website Settings menu, locate the Request Desktop Website option. Toggle the button to the On position. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . Once you’ve turned on the desktop mode, tap Done in the upper right corner of the screen to apply the change. From now on, you should see this website in desktop mode every time you visit it in Safari. You can always undo the change by going back into the Website Settings menu next time you visit the site.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. If you prefer to view all websites in desktop mode on your iPhone, you can change Safari’s settings to do this by default. To get started, go to your home screen and open Settings . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and select Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Safari . In the main Settings menu, scroll down until you find Safari . Tap it to open a new menu screen. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Request Desktop Website.
steps.content: Tap Request Desktop Website . Scroll down to the Settings for Websites section of the Safari Settings menu. Then, select Request Desktop Website . [9] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle on All Websites.
steps.content: Toggle on All Websites . When the new menu screen pops up, toggle on All Websites under Request Desktop Website On . From now on, Safari should display all websites in desktop mode unless you go back into settings and turn this option off. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Open the website you want to visit in Chrome.
steps.content: Open the website you want to visit in Chrome . Launch the Chrome app on your iPhone and type the URL of the website into the address bar at the top. Then, tap go to navigate to the site. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the ••• menu button.
steps.content: Tap the ••• menu button. This button is located at the bottom right side of the screen in Chrome. Tap it to open a popup menu. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Request Desktop Site.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Request Desktop Site . Once the popup appears, scroll down until you find Request Desktop Site . This option appears close to the bottom of the menu. After you tap it, the website should display in desktop mode. [13] X Research source If you visit other pages that are part of the same website during your current browsing session, they may also appear in desktop mode. To convert back to the mobile version, open the ••• menu again and tap Request Mobile Site . You can also switch to desktop mode by tapping the Share icon to the right of the address bar, then scrolling down and tapping Request Mobile Site . [14] X Research source
